batchMetadata.description: Firm quality control standards and engagement quality review

questions.question: A CPA firm's system of quality control should include policies addressing:

options.B: Leadership, ethics, client acceptance, HR, engagement performance, and monitoring

questions.explanation: Quality control systems address: leadership responsibilities, relevant ethical requirements (including independence), acceptance/continuance, human resources, engagement performance, and monitoring.
questions.tip: Six QC elements: Leadership, Ethics, Acceptance, HR, Performance, Monitoring.

questions.conceptTested: Tone at the top for quality
questions.question: Leadership responsibilities for quality within a firm means:

options.A: Partners have final say on fees
options.B: Firm leadership promotes a culture that quality is essential
options.C: Only managing partners are responsible for quality

questions.explanation: Firm leadership must promote an internal culture emphasizing that quality is essential. This includes demonstrating commitment to quality through actions, messages, and recognizing quality work.
questions.tip: Leadership sets tone that quality matters. Culture comes from the top.

questions.question: A firm's quality control policies regarding independence should:

options.B: Provide reasonable assurance that all personnel maintain independence where required

questions.explanation: Independence policies should provide reasonable assurance that all personnel (including partners and staff) maintain independence where required. This includes communication, confirmation, and monitoring.
questions.tip: Independence policies: All personnel, all applicable engagements, documented and monitored.

questions.question: Policies for client acceptance and continuance should ensure:

options.B: The firm only accepts clients where it has competence and integrity concerns are addressed

questions.explanation: Acceptance/continuance policies ensure the firm: evaluates client integrity, has competence and resources, can comply with ethical requirements, and can serve the client adequately.
questions.tip: Accept clients where: Integrity OK, Competence exists, Resources available, Ethics met.

questions.question: Human resource policies in a quality control system should address:

options.B: Recruitment, capabilities, competence, career development, and assignment of personnel

questions.explanation: HR policies should cover recruitment, capabilities assessment, competence development, professional development, performance evaluation, advancement, and appropriate assignment of personnel to engagements.
questions.tip: HR for quality: Recruit, develop, evaluate, assign appropriately. Right people, right work.

questions.question: Engagement performance policies should provide reasonable assurance that:

options.B: Engagements are performed in accordance with professional standards and requirements

questions.explanation: Performance policies ensure engagements are performed according to professional standards and regulatory/legal requirements, and reports issued are appropriate. This includes direction, supervision, and review.
questions.tip: Performance policies: Meet standards, proper supervision, appropriate reports.

questions.question: Monitoring of a firm's quality control system involves:

options.B: Ongoing consideration and periodic evaluation of QC system design and operation

questions.explanation: Monitoring includes ongoing consideration and periodic evaluation of the QC system's design and operation, inspection of completed engagements, and evaluation of whether policies are being followed.
questions.tip: Monitoring: Ongoing + Periodic evaluation. Is the QC system working?

questions.question: The purpose of an engagement quality review is to:

options.B: Provide an objective evaluation of significant judgments and conclusions

questions.explanation: EQR provides an objective evaluation of significant judgments made by the engagement team and conclusions reached in formulating the report. It's a second review by someone not on the team.
questions.tip: EQR = Objective second look at significant judgments. Not involved in engagement.

questions.question: For audits of issuers (public companies), engagement quality review is:

options.B: Required for all audit engagements

questions.explanation: PCAOB standards require engagement quality review for all audit engagements of issuers. The EQR reviewer must approve the report before its release. For nonissuers, firm policy determines when required.
questions.tip: PCAOB: EQR required for all issuer audits. AICPA: Firm policy determines.

questions.question: The engagement quality reviewer should be:

options.A: A staff member on the engagement
options.B: A partner or qualified individual not involved in the engagement with sufficient expertise
options.C: An external consultant in all cases

questions.explanation: The EQR reviewer should have sufficient technical expertise and experience, be objective (not involved in the engagement), and have authority to raise concerns. Usually a partner or senior manager.
questions.tip: EQR reviewer: Not on engagement, sufficient expertise, objective, authority to challenge.

questions.question: Engagement quality review procedures include:

options.B: Discussing significant matters with engagement partner, reviewing key documentation, and evaluating conclusions

questions.explanation: EQR involves: discussing significant matters with the engagement partner, reviewing financial statements and report, evaluating significant judgments, reviewing documentation supporting conclusions on significant matters.
questions.tip: EQR: Discuss, review key docs, evaluate significant judgments. Not re-audit.

questions.question: Quality control policies on consultation should ensure:

options.A: Consultation is discouraged to save time
options.B: Appropriate consultation occurs on difficult or contentious matters with qualified individuals

questions.explanation: Consultation policies ensure appropriate consultation occurs on difficult or contentious matters, that resources are available for consultation, and that conclusions reached are documented and implemented.
questions.tip: Consultation: Encourage on difficult matters. Document conclusions and implement.

questions.question: When differences of opinion arise within the engagement team, the report should:

options.A: Be issued with the partner's view only
options.B: Not be released until the difference is resolved and documented

questions.explanation: Quality control requires procedures for resolving differences of opinion. The report should not be released until the matter is resolved. The documentation should show the issue, resolution, and how conclusions were implemented.
questions.tip: Differences of opinion: Resolve before issuing report. Document the resolution.

questions.question: Documentation of firm quality control policies should:

options.B: Be maintained to demonstrate operation of each element of the QC system

questions.explanation: Firms should document QC policies and their operation. This includes evidence of operation of each QC element, monitoring results, and deficiencies identified and addressed.
questions.tip: Document QC system: What policies exist and evidence they're working.

questions.question: Peer review of a CPA firm serves to:

options.B: Provide external evaluation of the firm's quality control system

questions.explanation: Peer review provides an external, independent evaluation of whether a firm's QC system is designed and operating effectively to provide reasonable assurance of performing engagements according to standards.
questions.tip: Peer review: External check on firm's QC system. Required for AICPA membership.

questions.question: A system review in peer review covers:

options.B: Firms that perform audits, examinations, or reviews

questions.explanation: System reviews cover firms performing audits, examinations, or review engagements. Engagement reviews cover firms performing only compilations or preparation engagements. System reviews are more comprehensive.
questions.tip: System review: For firms doing audits/examinations/reviews. Comprehensive QC evaluation.

questions.question: The PCAOB conducts inspections of registered firms to:

options.A: Replace peer review for all firms
options.B: Assess compliance with PCAOB standards and identify quality control deficiencies

questions.explanation: PCAOB inspections assess whether registered firms comply with PCAOB standards, rules, and the securities laws. Inspections identify quality control deficiencies and audit deficiencies in reviewed engagements.
questions.tip: PCAOB inspections: Assess compliance, identify deficiencies. For firms auditing issuers.

questions.question: PCAOB inspections of firms that audit more than 100 issuers must occur:

options.B: Annually

questions.explanation: Firms that audit more than 100 issuers are inspected annually by the PCAOB. Firms auditing fewer issuers are inspected at least every three years.
questions.tip: PCAOB inspection frequency: >100 issuers = Annual. <100 issuers = Every 3 years.

questions.question: Proper supervision of engagement team members includes:

options.B: Tracking progress, reviewing work, addressing significant matters, and providing coaching

questions.explanation: Supervision includes: tracking progress, considering team competence, addressing significant matters that arise, reviewing work as it progresses, and providing appropriate coaching and feedback.
questions.tip: Supervision: Ongoing. Track progress, review work, address issues, coach team.

questions.question: The engagement partner is responsible for:

options.B: Overall quality, direction, supervision, performance according to standards, and the audit opinion

questions.explanation: The engagement partner has overall responsibility for: engagement quality, direction and supervision, performance according to professional standards, and appropriateness of the report issued.
questions.tip: Engagement partner: Overall responsibility for quality, supervision, standards compliance, and opinion.

questions.question: Review of engagement work should ensure that:

options.B: Work supports conclusions, evidence is sufficient, and standards are met
options.D: Review is optional if experienced staff are used

questions.explanation: Review of work ensures: procedures were performed according to plan, work performed supports conclusions, evidence is sufficient and appropriate, objectives were achieved, and report is appropriate.
questions.tip: Review purposes: Work supports conclusions, evidence adequate, standards met, report appropriate.

questions.question: Firm communication about quality control should:

options.B: Ensure personnel understand their QC responsibilities and keep them informed of QC matters

questions.explanation: QC communication should ensure all personnel understand their responsibilities for quality and are kept informed of QC policies, changes, and relevant matters affecting quality.
questions.tip: QC communication: Everyone understands their role. Ongoing, not just annually.

questions.question: When quality control deficiencies are identified, the firm should:

options.B: Evaluate causes, determine actions needed, communicate findings, and implement improvements

questions.explanation: Response to deficiencies includes: evaluating root causes, determining corrective actions, communicating findings to relevant personnel, considering whether systemic issues exist, and implementing improvements.
questions.tip: Deficiency response: Root cause analysis, corrective action, communication, systemic review.

questions.question: For small firms, quality control policies:

options.B: Should be tailored to the firm's size and circumstances while meeting all requirements
options.C: Must be identical to large firm policies

questions.explanation: Small firms must have QC systems but can tailor policies to their size and circumstances. For example, a sole practitioner may use external consultation rather than internal consultation resources.
questions.tip: Small firm QC: Same elements required, implementation can be scaled appropriately.

questions.question: Annual independence confirmations from personnel help ensure:

options.B: Personnel are aware of independence requirements and any violations are identified

questions.explanation: Annual confirmations require personnel to confirm their understanding of independence policies and whether any independence issues exist. This is part of monitoring independence compliance.
questions.tip: Independence confirmations: Awareness + Identification of potential issues.

questions.question: Policies for handling complaints and allegations should:

options.B: Enable reporting without fear of retaliation and ensure appropriate investigation

questions.explanation: Policies should enable personnel to raise concerns without fear of retaliation (whistleblower protection), ensure complaints are investigated appropriately, and document how allegations are resolved.
questions.tip: Complaint policies: Enable reporting, protect reporters, investigate, document resolution.

questions.question: Inspection of completed engagements as part of monitoring should:

options.B: Include a selection of engagements, with at least one per engagement partner over a cycle
options.C: Occur only when problems are suspected

questions.explanation: Monitoring should inspect selected completed engagements on a cyclical basis, ensuring each engagement partner has at least one engagement inspected during a defined cycle. Selection considers risk factors.
questions.tip: Inspection cycle: Selection of engagements, all partners covered over cycle period.

questions.question: During peer review, client confidentiality:

options.A: Does not apply to peer reviewers
options.B: Must be maintained, with peer reviewers also bound by confidentiality
options.C: Prevents any review of client files
options.D: Requires client consent for every file reviewed

questions.explanation: Peer reviewers are bound by the same confidentiality requirements. They can review client files as part of the review but cannot disclose confidential information. This enables effective peer review.
questions.tip: Peer review confidentiality: Reviewers bound by same rules. Can access, can't disclose.

questions.question: Continuing professional education requirements support quality control by:

options.B: Ensuring personnel maintain and develop competence to perform quality work

questions.explanation: CPE helps ensure personnel maintain competence in changing technical areas, develop new skills, and stay current with professional standardsâ€”all essential for quality work.
questions.tip: CPE supports quality: Current knowledge, developing skills, maintaining competence.

questions.question: Before accepting a new audit client, the firm should evaluate:

options.B: Client integrity, firm competence, independence, and ability to serve properly
options.C: Only whether the client is publicly traded

questions.explanation: New client evaluation includes: management integrity assessment, whether firm has competence and capacity, ability to meet ethical requirements including independence, and whether the firm can properly serve the client.
questions.tip: New client acceptance: Integrity, competence, independence, capacity. All must be OK.

questions.question: Quality control policies should address withdrawal from an engagement including:

options.B: Conditions warranting withdrawal, communication requirements, and documentation
options.C: Refund of all fees in all cases

questions.explanation: Withdrawal policies should address: circumstances where withdrawal is appropriate (integrity issues, scope limitations), required communications (to management, governance, regulators), and documentation of reasons.
questions.tip: Withdrawal policies: When appropriate, who to notify, document reasons.

questions.question: Engagement documentation should be assembled in the final file:

options.A: Within one year of report date
options.B: Within a specified period after the report date (45 days for PCAOB, 60 for AICPA)

questions.explanation: Documentation assembly has deadlines: 45 days from report release for PCAOB (issuers), 60 days for AICPA standards (nonissuers). After assembly, documentation cannot be deleted.
questions.tip: Documentation deadlines: PCAOB = 45 days. AICPA = 60 days. Then archive locked.

questions.question: A firm's quality control policies regarding confidentiality should ensure:

options.A: Client information can be shared freely within the industry
options.B: Client information is protected and disclosed only when permitted or required
options.C: Confidentiality applies only to large clients
options.D: Staff can discuss client matters socially

questions.explanation: Confidentiality policies ensure client information is protected, accessed only for proper purposes, and disclosed only when required by law or permitted by the client. This includes physical and electronic security.
questions.tip: Confidentiality: Protect information, limited access, disclosure only when permitted/required.

questions.question: Technology used in a firm's quality control system should:

options.B: Be appropriately designed, implemented, and monitored to support QC objectives

questions.explanation: Technology supporting QC should be appropriate for the firm, properly implemented, secured, and monitored. This includes systems for independence tracking, engagement management, knowledge resources, and documentation.
questions.tip: QC technology: Appropriate design, proper implementation, ongoing monitoring.

questions.question: When the PCAOB identifies deficiencies, the firm must:

options.B: Respond within a specified time, describing actions taken or planned to address deficiencies

questions.explanation: Firms must respond to PCAOB inspection reports within 12 months, describing remediation actions. Quality control deficiencies may remain nonpublic if satisfactorily addressed within the response period.
questions.tip: PCAOB response: 12 months to respond. Address to keep QC deficiencies nonpublic.
